trial_identification.studytitle: A Prospective, Single-Arm, Two-Stage, Open-Label, Phase II Trial of CYT997 in Relapsed and Refractory Multiple Myeloma
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Prospective, Single-Arm, Two-Stage, Open-Label, Phase II Trial of CYT997 in Relapsed and Refractory Multiple Myeloma

interventions.interventions: CYT997 is administered as a 24-hour intravenous infusion at a dose of 202mg/m2 on days 1 and 8 of a 21 day cycle for up to three cycles
interventions.comparator: There is no control group in this study.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Response will be measured after each cycle (ie every three weeks).

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Progression will be measured each cycle (ie every three weeks).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Number of cycles of CYT997 required to achieve maximal response.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Response will be measured each cycle (ie every three weeks). The number of cycles required to attain maximal response will be determined on an ongoing basis by comparison with data collected during treatment for that patient.
Overall survival will be measured on an ongoing basis during the study and whilst the patient remains on CYT997 therapy.
Safety and tolerability will be assessed on an ongoing basis during the patients' participation in the trial.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Diagnosis of multiple myeloma as per WHO (World Health Organisation) criteria. Age 18 years or greater. Patients must have received at least one but no more than 3 prior lines of myeloma therapy. Patients must have failed to respond to the most recently administered anti-myeloma therapy or have demonstrably progressive disease by accepted clinical criteria. Patients must have a life expectancy of at least 3 months. ECOG (Eastern Co-operative Oncology Group) performance status <3. Patients must be willing and able to given informed, written consent. Patients must agree to use adequate contraceptive measures if indicated.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Patients with monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance. Known or suspective hypersensitivity to CYT997. Patient with uncontrolled intercurrent illness. Patients who are pregnant or lactating. Patient who have received other investigational agents within the preceding three weeks prior to starting therapy. Patients with heart-attack or stroke within the preceding 6 months; unstable angina pectoris; history of diabetic retinopathy or major surgery in the preceding 30 days will be excluded. Patients with a baseline prolongation of the QTc interval (QT interval corrected for heart rate) >450 msec. Patients with impaired cardiac function or clinically significant cardiac disease. Patients currently receiving treatment with medications known to prolong the QTc interval.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Level 2, 499 St Kilda Road, Melbourne VIC 3004

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Level 2, 499 St Kilda Road, Melbourne VIC 3004

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Laboratory studies indicate that CYT997 is able to potently inhibit myeloma cells from patients with this condition. Given these favourable "test tube" findings, Cytopia has decided to investigate whether CYT997, when given to patients with multiple myeloma, can improve their condition and extend survival from the disease. The effect of CYT997 in patients will be determined from analysis of blood plasma and bone marrow samples and comparison to accepted clinical standards for response in multiple myeloma.
